definition: variant of 尚方劍|尚方剑[shang4 fang1 jian4]/imperial sword (giving bearer arbitrary powers)/in fiction, Chinese version of 007's license to kill

square/power or involution (math.)/upright/honest/fair and square/direction/side/party (to a contract, dispute etc)/place/method/prescription (medicine)/just when/only or just/classifier for square things/abbr. for square or cubic meter
double-edged sword/CL:口[kou3],把[ba3]/classifier for blows of a sword
imperial sword (giving bearer plenipotentiary powers)/imperial Chinese version of 007 licensed to kill
imperial sword (giving bearer arbitrary powers)/in fiction, Chinese version of 007's license to kill
act at one's discretion/act as one sees fit
first decapitate then present your trophy (idiom); act first, report later
to be bestowed, conferred, or granted by the emperor

tiger tally (a two-piece object made in the shape of a tiger, used in ancient China as proof of authority. One half of a tally could be issued to a military officer and this would be matched with the other half when verification was required.)
lever-style guillotine decorated with a dragon's head at the hinged end, used to behead criminals related to the emperor
